name: Weatherlight
tagline: Forecasting the weather in style with a color coded LED strip
body:
### Weatherlight.
Led strip indicating the weather of the next day with colors.

It has been written with Arduino and ESP8266 in mind, but it should be quite portable so you can use this code in any other C++ project.

### Getting started
You'll need:
- ESP8266 (NodeMCU) or Arduino Uno (with Ethernet shield)
- openweathermap account: [openweathermap website](https://home.openweathermap.org/users/sign_up)
- Google App Engine (GAE) account: [GAE website](https://appengine.google.com)

Make sure to check out the [README](https://github.com/svanscho/weatherlight) to update the service configuration for your specific needs and any other additional details.

### Authors and Contributors
In 2015, Sander Van Schoote (@svschoot) created weatherlight.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with weatherlight? Check out our [readme](https://github.com/svanscho/weatherlight) or [contact me](mailto:vanschoote.sander@gmail.com) and Iâ€™ll help you sort it out.
